When I got my Siberian husky at 2 weeks old, we put her in her own room with a little baby gate to keep her in, because we have another smaller dog who doesn’t like other dogs and this was how we were introducing them. We came home one day to find her walking around the house without a care in the world and the other dog ignoring her completely. We put her back in her room only to have her climbing over the baby gate within 20 seconds. It was the funniest shit I’ve ever seen but we had to put 2 baby gates to keep her from climbing over.

Ok
I’m just saying some people are and it has helped people
I’m actually a regular on there and all my posts have at least one reply that’s usually at least attempting to be kind and helpful
I think you are, to most people that was made dead rising dead rising, 99% of people who played the other games believe without it it lost its identity as a dead rising game.
My original post was not inviting a debate though,   in no way did I invite a debate, but you comment showing your insistence to tell me my opinion is wrong was however an invite to a debate.
J don’t think so because most people fucking hate when a game plays like that

Dude, me saying “i personally think this game wasn’t as bad as everyone said it was at launch” is not inviting people for debate, it’s only inviting a debate if you’re desperate to shit talk the game at every chance you get.
Jesus Christ, you just can not except other people’s opinions can you? Notice how in my post I said “in my opinion.” Never said it was an objective fact.

Again, I didn’t say it did anything better than any of the previous games. I didn’t say it had better AI, I didn’t say it had better zombie AI, I didn’t say it had better zombie killing, I’m just saying it’s not a godawful game on its own like everyone is saying it is. The zombie killing isn’t better, but it’s not terrible. The aren’t smarter, but they aren’t totally brain dead either. Literally all I am  saying is that even though it was the worst dead rising game, it was just mediocre, not the worst game ever made like everyone makes it out to be. The horde AI was similar to DR3 though, even if DR3 had better AI overall I’m standing by that in both games the general hordes of zombies were piss easy to shove through
I agree, that’s exactly what I was trying to say, bad dead rising game but not a terrible game in general

I got the special edition for dirt cheap with all the DLC so I didn’t have that problem. And yeah I agree it was barely a dead rising game and was still not that great, I’m not trying to argue that, I’m
just saying it wasn’t as bad as everyone says it is, its not the worst game ever made, its just mediocre.

They’re literally almost the exact same as DR3’s zombies, I played DR3 a bit at my friends house once even if I never actually owned it and they barely touched me, I could push through entire hordes no problem. And the survivor AI in 2 wasn’t as good as everyone says it is, it’s just not as bad as DR1. DR1 had unbearable AI and DR2 has tolerable AI, that doesn’t mean it has GOOD AI. And I didn’t say anything about maniacs or psychopaths or anything like that, I never played any of those missions because I didn’t care for them either, but running around killing nameless enemy survivors and soldiers is still enjoyable.

I said it was the worst dead rising game, didn’t I? I didn’t say it was just as good or better for killing zombies than the other games, I just said It was still fun, because it is. Zombies still squish good. And the human AI has always been terrible in every dead rising game ever made. The soldiers in DR1 were only a threat because they were way too accurate, and TK’s soldiers in DR2 were a slight improvement but still had no sense of self preservation.
